Package java_gui

Class MainApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • java_gui.MainApplication
  • public class MainApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    This class sets up all JPanels used as scenes in the application. Inside this class are individual methods that manage the panels and their tasks.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      (package private) class  MainApplication.CustomRenderer
      CustomRenderer is a specialized table cell renderer that customizes the appearance of tables cells in a specific column.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainApplication

        public MainApplication()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the main application window and sets up all the JPanel scenes for the application. It configures the main layout, creates various screens such as landing, size, entree, side, and payment screens, and sets up the navigation between them using a CardLayout.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • makeOrders

        public javax.swing.JPanel makeOrders()
        This method sets up the JPanels with all the Order info in it. It can be updated with highlighting and hitting the delete button, or with adding items to this order.
        Returns:
        JPanel with the orders

      • createManagerView

        public javax.swing.JPanel createManagerView()
        This class sets up the manager view; it creates buttons that call their respective functions for sql data and formatting windows
        Returns:
        Manager JPanel

      • showXReport

        void showXReport()
        This function displays the X report then displays it in a chart format It pulls data by sales per hour, both in quantity and total price. It puts the display in a new pop-up window.

      • showZReport

        void showZReport()
        Displays the Z Report in a new window, showing a summary of daily sales. The report includes the total number of orders, items sold, and the total sales amount. Data is retrieved from the database and presented in a table format.

      • showInventory

        private void showInventory()
        This method displays the current inventory

      • showNewItemMenu

        private void showNewItemMenu()
        Displays a form in a new window that allows the user to add a new menu item and its corresponding inventory items. The form includes fields for item name, ID, type, and inventory details, with dynamic input for multiple inventory items.

      • showSales

        private void showSales()
        Displays the sales report in a new window, allowing users to generate a report based on a selected date range. The report retrieves product sales data from the database and presents it in a table format.

      • showProdUsage

        private void showProdUsage()
        Displays a report of product usage in a new window based on a selected date range. The report shows inventory items, units, and the total quantity used, retrieved from the database and presented in a table format.

      • showTrends

        private void showTrends()

      • showEmployees

        private void showEmployees()
        Displays a window showing a list of employees fetched from the database. The employee data, including ID, name, position, and active status, is presented in a table format.

      • showRestockReport

        private void showRestockReport()
        Displays the restock report in a new window, showing inventory items with quantities below 40. The report retrieves data from the database and presents it in a table format, with low-stock items highlighted.
